post_detail.title: I Play Lacrosse
post_detail.description:
I play Lacrosse for the athletic challenges it offers and for the opportunities to be a leader that it creates. The sport requires a high degree of individual discipline and practice, but ultimately success depends on teamwork.

I sustain high-level, full-contact, competitive play in various men's lacrosse leagues throughout the year. Previous teams include the Philadelphia Barrage (Professional, Major League Lacrosse), Tri State (Semi-Pro American Lacrosse League), Salt Shakerz (Club traveling team), Hoboken Lacrosse (Summer league). I participate in youth clinics through the organizations and travel to cities around the country to compete in tournaments (e.g. Miami, Las Vegas, Vail, Lake Placid, Jersey Shore, New Orleans).

In college, I was a 4 year starter at the NCAA Division I level. Our team ranked consistently within top 15 nationally in USILA Polls. I led team in ground-balls and takeaways for 3 years; '03 North/South All-Star game Captain; Participated in team sanctioned philanthropic activities and community service; 2 Year All-Conference Player; Named to the 2003 Scholar All American Team; Awarded athletic and merit-based scholarship.
